page.title: 03LIFE STYLES
page.content: {MUGGARTHAUGH HOTEL} The hotel is isolately situated 4 miles from Alford near pretty Muir of Fowlis. The building was first erected as a farmhouse. From the 1800's the building was used as a watering hole for travellers and their horses. The name 'Muggarthaugh' has two possible origins. 'Mugwart' (from the Gaelic word 'Mugach' meaning damp, cloudy and misty) was a plant which possibly grew near the site. Also, tinkers, who may have camped there, made bowls and mugs and were called 'muggers'. Haugh is a hill. A night's stay including breakfast cost approximately Â£16. Family barbecues and ceilidhs (traditional songs and dances)are held during summer.The function room can cater for 150-200 people and is used for weddings, christening parties, funeral teas and bustrip teas.
